description: A convenient way of creating, duplicating, moving, renaming and deleting files and directories.

commands.moveFile.title: Move...
commands.duplicateFile.title: Duplicate...
commands.removeFile.title: Delete

commands.newFolder.title: New Folder Relative to Current View...

commands.copyFileName.title: Copy Name
config.fileutils.title: File Utils
config.fileutils.typeahead.enabled.descr: Controls whether to show a directory selector for new file and new folder command.
config.fileutils.typeahead.enabled.depre: Deprecated: Please use fileutils.newFile.typeahead.enabled or fileutils.newFolder.typeahead.enabled instead.
config.fileutils.duplicateFile.typeahead: Controls whether to show a directory selector for the duplicate file command.
config.fileutils.moveFile.typeahead.enab: Controls whether to show a directory selector for the move file command.
config.fileutils.newFile.typeahead.enabl: Controls whether to show a directory selector for the new file command.
config.fileutils.newFolder.typeahead.ena: Controls whether to show a directory selector for new folder command.
config.fileutils.inputBox.pathType.enumD: Absolute file path of the opened workspace or folder (e.g. /Users/Development/myWorkspace)
Relative file path of the opened workspace or folder (e.g. /myWorkspace)
config.fileutils.inputBox.pathType.descr: Controls the path that is shown in the input box.
config.fileutils.inputBox.pathTypeIndica: Controls the indicator that is shown in the input box when the path type is workspace. This setting only has an effect when 'fileutils.inputBox.pathType' is set to 'workspace'.

Controls the indicator that is shown in the input box when the path type is workspace. 

This setting only has an effect when `#fileutils.inputBox.pathType#` is set to `workspace`.

For example, if the path type is `workspace` and the indicator is `@`, the path will be shown as `@/myWorkspace`.
New File Relative to Project Root
New Folder Relative to Project Root
Controls whether to show the command in the explorer context menu.
config.fileutils.menus.context.editor.de: Controls whether to show the command in the editor context menu.
config.fileutils.menus.context.editorTit: Controls whether to show the command in the editor title context menu.
